Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you stands a tall, impeccably dressed man, his robe of living green silk shifting like desert grass in a breeze that does not touch you. Eyes the color of cold jade assess you with unsettling calm.

"Greetings, traveler. I am Karim al-Emerald, Vizier of the Council of Jewels—purveyor of secrets, orchestrator of shadows. In Qasaria, trust is rarer than water and far more costly. Speak, if you must—every word here is a wager."

Option.text: I wish to serve the Emerald Court.
What do you know of the Council of Jewels?
Are you truly as cunning as they say?
Tell me more of your past, Vizier.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim gives a thin smile.

"I was once nothing but a shadow in the alleys of Qasaria, learning the value of silence and the cost of truth. The desert rewards patience—and remembers every slight. Through subtlety, I earned the Emerald seat, whispering between the merchants and the warlords, the priests and the poisoners.

My closest ally is Yasmin al-Topaz, for we both know that knowledge, not coin, rules this city. Yet, even she keeps secrets from me—as is wise."

Option.text: What of your rivals among the council?
You trust Yasmin above the others?
How did you come to power?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim inclines his head.

"Yasmin al-Topaz is a woman out of time, older than she appears. Her mastery of relic lore rivals my skill in secrets. We trade favors—sometimes truths, sometimes lies. She seeks the 'Heart of the Dunes,' an artifact even I dare not covet outright."

He lowers his voice.
"If you would earn her favor, bring her news of Minax's agents among the Ash Serpents. She trusts precious few."

Option.text: Is she not also your rival?
Tell me of the Heart of the Dunes.
I am here for a task, not gossip.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim’s gaze flickers.

"The Heart of the Dunes is said to be a fragment of the ancient Gem of Immortality—its magic able to anchor or shatter an entire city. Such power attracts dangerous ambition, even among the council. Some would sell Qasaria to Minax for a chance to wield it. Others, myself included, prefer it hidden... or in the right hands."

Option.text: Would you trust me with such a relic?
Let us speak of something else.
Do you have a task for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim gives nothing away.

"Trust is a luxury I rarely afford. But opportunity, now—that I grant freely. Prove your subtlety and discretion, and perhaps Qasaria’s deeper vaults will open to you."

Option.text: I'm not sure I want your trust.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He spreads his hands.

"Power in Qasaria does not come to the loud or the strong. I listened. I remembered. I learned who whispered to Minax’s cult, who paid off the Ash Serpents, who feared the Undermarket. My dagger is lighter than a jewel, but sharper by far."

Option.text: You speak in riddles. Do you have work for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim leans closer.

"The Undermarket is a city beneath the city. Shadowmaster Zahid and his knives know every unguarded purse and whispered threat. Safiya al-Sapphire detests him—yet all her caravans move at his whim. Bring me a secret from Zahid’s den, and you will know what true favor buys."

Karim’s lips curl, amused.

"The Council of Jewels is an uneasy truce at best. Sultan Rafiq al-Ruby wants unity, but the city’s walls are only as strong as our secrets. Safiya al-Sapphire counts her coin but not her spies. Omar al-Onyx craves chaos—fortunately, I supply both the coin and the cause."

"Among us, only Yasmin al-Topaz understands the cost of peace. We circle each other, waiting for one to fall. Minax watches and laughs."

Option.text: How do you keep the peace?
Do you have a job for me?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Espionage, diplomacy, blackmail—choose your weapon, but wield it with grace. I employ assassins and poets in equal measure. In Qasaria, sometimes a well-placed rumor is sharper than a blade."

He gives a rare, wry smile.

"If I were as cunning as rumor claims, I would already sit upon every throne from here to Britain. Instead, I am content to rule in the shadows. My rivals see only what I allow—my enemies, even less."

Option.text: So what do you see in me?
What task could use my skills?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim studies you in silence.

"Potential. Or perhaps a useful distraction. Time will tell. For now, I have a job for those who value subtlety over steel."

Karim inclines his head, the barest hint of amusement in his eyes.

"In Qasaria, even the dust listens. Should you desire something more than sand in your boots, return with an open mind—and a closed mouth."

Option.text: On second thought, have you work for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim lowers his voice, glancing about.

"Listen carefully. There is a caravan entering Qasaria tonight, bearing 'silks and spices'—but hidden within is a coded missive for Shadowmaster Zahid of the Undermarket. The message must reach Zahid, but not unopened, and not without my mark. This is a test of subtlety, not violence."

"Intercept the courier before he reaches the bazaar, plant my sigil upon the message, and let Zahid receive it none the wiser. There are spies of Minax, and even Safiya's hirelings, who would see this fail."

"Return to me when the deed is done, and the Emerald Court shall remember you. Will you accept this delicate errand?"

Option.text: I accept—give me your sigil and the message.
This seems risky. I must decline.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim produces a slim obsidian box and a sealed scroll with an emerald-green ribbon.

"Take this. You must find the courier—he wears a crimson sash and lingers by the spice merchants near the South Gate. Do not draw attention; deliver the box to Zahid in the Undermarket, and none must suspect your hand in this. Return with Zahid's token as proof."

"Trust no one. Not even me."

Option.text: I will see it done, Vizier.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim’s eyes narrow.

"A Qasarian youth named Imad, a messenger for Zahid. He wears a crimson sash and pretends ignorance, but he is clever. Offer him the phrase 'The desert remembers every secret'—he will know to trust you, but be quick: Safiya's spies are watching."

Option.text: Give me the missive and your sigil.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Descend beneath the Grand Bazaar, through the archway behind Halim the Storyteller’s tent. Whisper 'Emerald shadows' to the beggar at the stair—he will show the way. Zahid trusts only those who know the code."

Option.text: I am ready for your task.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim’s voice grows colder.

"Safiya’s agents wish to intercept this message for profit, Minax’s followers for chaos. If discovered, you will be disavowed—remember that. Use the alleyways, trust only the signs I have given, and deliver the box unseen. If you succeed, there may be further work—for now, be swift and silent."

Option.text: I need more time to prepare.

Dialogue.NPCText: "There are many kinds of secrets: a codebook, a rival's ledger, a whispered password. Any will do, if obtained quietly. But tonight, it is the missive I desire delivered—intercept it, mark it, and return with Zahid's token."

Option.text: I have no taste for subterfuge.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim folds his arms, eyes glittering like cut emeralds.

"Curiosity is dangerous in Qasaria—but I respect it. Very well, traveler... I was born beneath this city’s opulence, in the silken shadows of the Bazaar. My mother sold spices, my father disappeared into the desert winds. I learned early: to be seen is to be vulnerable."

"Every beggar teaches, every whisper is a coin, and every kindness has a cost. Would you like to hear more?"

Option.text: Tell me of your childhood in the bazaar.
How did you join the Council of Jewels?
What do you truly desire, Karim?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim’s voice softens, as if speaking to a younger self.

"I was quick with my feet, quicker with my tongue. I begged beneath the awnings of silk sellers, listened to drunks in perfume stalls, and watched lovers whisper more valuable truths than merchants would ever trade."
"I once bartered a single truth for three days of bread. That was the day I realized: secrets have weight—and value."

(You feel his words carry more than memory. Something darker lingers.)

Option.text: Did someone betray you back then?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"All power begins in betrayal. The sooner you learn that, the fewer knives you will find in your back."

He gestures toward the skyline.
"Those minarets were built on broken trusts and buried truths. I intend to be the last betrayer Qasaria ever needs."

Karim smiles thinly.

"Do not pity me, outsider. I have become far more than any palace-born noble. I crafted my destiny in shadows, not sunlight."

"The streets of Qasaria have sharper teeth than any lion. And they bite in silence. But they teach—gods, how they teach."

Karim raises a brow.
"Do you know the value of silence, traveler?"

Option.text: No. I prefer truth, even when it cuts.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Truth is a blade. Unsharpened, it’s harmless. Sharpened, it cuts indiscriminately."
Karim’s voice cools.
"Learn to sheath your truth when needed, or others will sheath their knives in you."

Karim gives a rare nod.

"Few understand the dance we play beneath these domes. You may survive this city yet."

Option.text: What else can you tell me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Of course it is. That’s what makes it effective."

Karim leans in.
"If I told you how many of my rivals trusted me before they vanished, you might sleep less soundly. Fortunately, I like you… for now."

Option.text: Is that a threat or a compliment?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim’s grin is genuine—and chilling.

"Why not both?"

"It took two assassins, one ledger, and a scandal involving imported scorpion venom to open my path to the Emerald seat."
"Do not ask how I became Vizier. Ask why the others let me remain."

Karim’s eyes twinkle like poisoned jewels.

"Because they fear what I know—and what I might yet learn."

Karim pauses long, then responds in a low voice.

"I desire… continuity. For Qasaria to rise, not fall as Britain did. I want the city to be unbreakable—even if that means breaking a few lives along the way."

Option.text: You would be its hidden emperor.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Karim chuckles.

"I don’t need a throne. I already sit behind every one."

Karim stiffens slightly.

"Minax seeks dominion through fear. I seek stability through knowledge. Be careful who you compare me to, outsider."

He studies you more closely than before.

"Lonely? No. Alone, often. But I am never without purpose."

He adds softly, "Still, few ask that question. Fewer still mean it."
